conclusion: Identify the gas as ideal and temperature at state C as 300K with pressure and volume.
Introduce the ideal gas law equation pV = nRT.
Calculate nR using state C: nR = 2/75.
Determine pressure and volume at state B from the graph: p_B = 2 x 10^3 Pa, V_B = 4 x 10^-3 m^3.
Use ideal gas law to find temperature at state B: T_B = 300K.
Conclude that the temperature of the gas in state B is 300K.
